item.description:
Help put a dent in McCain's campaign (and help Ron Paul) with 'Stop McCain in Ohio'

Automated, pre-recorded telephone messages to targeted Ohio Republican voters, especially those who voted in the 2004 presidential primary in NW Ohio. This area is heavily Republican and was pivotal in helping George Bush win the election in 2004.

Two rounds of telephone calls (database validation and calls), the first on March 1 and the second on March 3, will cost about $15,000 to reach 280,000 voters between the ages of 35 and 65. No live volunteers involvement as all 280,000 calls are sent out in a 2 hour time period. The message is strictly anti-McCain.

There are 88 delegates at stake in Ohio. A loss of any dimension to McCain in Ohio, a bell weather state, will help Ron Paul.

CONTRIBUTE NOW
item.name: 'Stop McCain in Ohio!'
